content: for structure and strength you may choose to use kitchener stitch grafting instead for a flatter join sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 8 set-in sleeve body make 2 co 28 sts row 1 k1 k1 p1 to last st k1 row 2 p1 k1 p1 to last st p1 row 3 k8 kfb k9 kfb k to end 30 sts work 23 row stockinette stitch row 27 bobble 4 sts k to end 26 sts row 28 bobble 4 sts p to end 22 sts work 10 row stockinette stitch cut two pieces of waste yarn 4 long each row 39 k7 sl sts to waste yarn bo8 k to end two groups of 7 sts row 40 p across 7 sts row 41 bo2 k to end 5 sts row 42 p across and sl sts to waste yarn move 7 reserved sts to needle and rejoin yarn in position for a right-side row row 40 k across row 41 bo2 p to end 5 sts row 42 k across sl sts to waste yarn sleeves make 2 co 24 sts row 1 k1 k1 p1 to last st k1 row 2 p1 k1 p1 to last st p1 row 3 k2 m1r k to last 2 sts m1l k2 26 sts st st three row row 7 repeat row 3 28 sts row 8 p across row 9 bobble four sts 1 st rem on right needle k1 k2tog k12 ssk k6 22 sts row 10 bobble four sts p to end 18 sts *row 11 k2 k2tog k to last 4 sts ssk k2 16 sts row 12 p across repeat from *three more times 10 sts work row 11 once more 8 sts and then bobble scoop neck collar and finishing place both body panels facing each other and place reserved stitches onto needles 5 sts per shoulder work a three-needle bind-off at each shoulder pick up 36 collar stitches *5 from shoulder seam down 8 across the bound-off stitches at the center 5 up to the seam repeat from * arrange on three needles to work in the round and work 2 rounds k1p1 ribbing bobble mattress stitch sleeve caps into armholes mattress stitch side seams from cuff to hem block sweater smoothing flat sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 9 drop shoulder worked flat the chart includes guidance for using stranded as well as intarsia techniques to keep motif tidy and strands of yarn to a minimum this sweater body is wider than the others because the boxy shape doesn t conform to the shape of the wearer and so needs more ease how to read intarsia charts worked flat back and forth video tutorial from planetpurl https //youtu be/byuccpwv1l4 how to lock the colors together when working intarsia video tutorial from very pink knits https //youtu be/ptjdamqxlau sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 10 drop shoulder setup
